qas.question: What became publicly available on 6 December 1991?
When can patents not be filed in most countries?

answers.text: after prior art has been made public

qas.question: How long does it take for patents to expire after being filed?
How long can it take for patents to be approved after initially being filed?
When did patents required to implement MP3 expire in most countries?

context: The initial near-complete <a0_0>MPEG-1 standard<a0_0/> (parts 1, 2 and 3) was publicly available on 6 December 1991 as ISO CD 11172. In most countries, patents cannot be filed <a1_0>after prior art has been made public<a1_0/>, and patents expire <a2_0>20 years<a2_0/> after the initial filing date, which can be up to <a3_0>12 months<a3_0/> later for filings in other countries. As a result, patents required to implement MP3 expired in most countries by <a4_0>December 2012<a4_0/>, 21 years after the publication of ISO CD 11172.
